title: How to Change a Harp String

steps.headline: Make a simple knot in the string.
Overlap the loop on the knot in the direction indicated by the arrow, holding onto points B and C of the knot.
Tighten the loop on the knot in the direction indicated by the arrow, holding points B and C of the knot still.
From the strings of the 3rd octave to those of the 0 octave, insert an anchor in the knot by using a 2-cm piece of gut string from the 5th octave.
steps.description: Tighten by pulling the string outward, holding points B and C of the knot still.

methods.name: Winding Nylon Strings of the 0 and 1st Octaves and Gut Strings of the 2nd and 3rd Octaves on the Tuning Pin

steps.headline: Thread the string into the hole of the tuning pin and pull upward (for the 0 and 1st octave strings, thread the string into the hole of the pin twice).
Use the tuning key to turn the tuning pin clockwise.
Make a loop and fix it under the string by turning the pin further clockwise.
Turn the pin clockwise, taking care the keep the string to the right of the hole.
Winding the string correctly: to the right of the hole in the direction of the neck.

methods.name: Winding Gut Strings of the 4th and 5th Octaves on the Tapered Tuning Pin

steps.headline: Thread the string into the hole of the tapered pin and pull upward.
Turn the pin clockwise, taking care the keep the string to the right of the hole.

methods.name: Winding Metal Strings on the Tapered Tuning Pin

steps.headline: Thread the string into the hole of the tapered pin and pull upward.
Release the string pulling it out about 4 cm (2 - 3 fingers).
Turn the pin clockwise, taking care to keep the string to the right of the hole.

text: Knotting Nylon and Gut Strings Make a simple knot in the string.  Make a loop as indicated.  Overlap the loop on the knot in the direction indicated by the arrow, holding onto points B and C of the knot.  Tighten the loop on the knot in the direction indicated by the arrow, holding points B and C of the knot still.  From the strings of the 3rd octave to those of the 0 octave, insert an anchor in the knot by using a 2-cm piece of gut string from the 5th octave. Tighten by pulling the string outward, holding points B and C of the knot still. Winding Nylon Strings of the 0 and 1st Octaves and Gut Strings of the 2nd and 3rd Octaves on the Tuning Pin Thread the string into the hole of the tuning pin and pull upward (for the 0 and 1st octave strings, thread the string into the hole of the pin twice).  Use the tuning key to turn the tuning pin clockwise.  Make a loop and fix it under the string by turning the pin further clockwise.  Turn the pin clockwise, taking care the keep the string to the right of the hole.  Winding the string correctly: to the right of the hole in the direction of the neck.  Winding Gut Strings of the 4th and 5th Octaves on the Tapered Tuning Pin Thread the string into the hole of the tapered pin and pull upward. Continue turning the pin clockwise. Turn the pin clockwise, taking care the keep the string to the right of the hole.  Winding Metal Strings on the Tapered Tuning Pin Thread the string into the hole of the tapered pin and pull upward.  Release the string pulling it out about 4 cm (2 - 3 fingers).  Turn the pin clockwise, taking care to keep the string to the right of the hole.
sentences: Knotting Nylon and Gut Strings Make a simple knot in the string.
Overlap the loop on the knot in the direction indicated by the arrow, holding onto points B and C of the knot.
Tighten the loop on the knot in the direction indicated by the arrow, holding points B and C of the knot still.
From the strings of the 3rd octave to those of the 0 octave, insert an anchor in the knot by using a 2-cm piece of gut string from the 5th octave.
Tighten by pulling the string outward, holding points B and C of the knot still.

Winding Nylon Strings of the 0 and 1st Octaves and Gut Strings of the 2nd and 3rd Octaves on the Tuning Pin Thread the string into the hole of the tuning pin and pull upward (for the 0 and 1st octave strings, thread the string into the hole of the pin twice).
Use the tuning key to turn the tuning pin clockwise.
Make a loop and fix it under the string by turning the pin further clockwise.
Turn the pin clockwise, taking care the keep the string to the right of the hole.
Winding the string correctly: to the right of the hole in the direction of the neck.
Winding Gut Strings of the 4th and 5th Octaves on the Tapered Tuning Pin Thread the string into the hole of the tapered pin and pull upward.
Turn the pin clockwise, taking care the keep the string to the right of the hole.
Winding Metal Strings on the Tapered Tuning Pin Thread the string into the hole of the tapered pin and pull upward.
Release the string pulling it out about 4 cm (2 - 3 fingers).
Turn the pin clockwise, taking care to keep the string to the right of the hole.
